function.summary: Return the period start dateTime for finite durations and the instant dateTime for instants.

documentation.xhtml:p: For the dates, XBRL uses a union of date and dateTime. When a date is specified, it should be expanded to a dateTime as specified in the XBRL specification. Note that this expansion differs for start dates and instant dates.

input.name: period
input.xhtml:p: The period for which to obtain the period start.

output.xhtml:p: Return the period start dateTime for finite durations and the instant dateTime for instants. For a start date without time, the dateTime returned is the midnight at the start of the date reported, as if the time portion were "T00:00:00". For an instant date without time, the dateTime returned is is the midnight at the end of the date reported, conceptually as if the time portion were "T24:00:00".

error.xhtml:p: This error MUST be thrown if the item is reported with a forever period.

reg:revision.xhtml:p: Clarified time portion of output when only date is reported, without time.
